title: How the microbiota controls neutrophil activity

title_detail.value: How the microbiota controls neutrophil activity

summary: A host protein called Serum Amyloid A (Saa) is a major factor mediating the effects of the microbiota on the function of immune cells called neutrophils, according to a new study.

summary_detail.value: A host protein called Serum Amyloid A (Saa) is a major factor mediating the effects of the microbiota on the function of immune cells called neutrophils, according to a new study.
